Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course is brilliant! I left the course feeling more versed in the scholarly discourse on religion and empire. Additionally, as a better writer, reader, and researcher. My capacity for intellectual thinking, curiosity, and analysis broaden tremendously through this course!

I learned methodology outside my bounds that will serve me greatly later. This includes things such as Sylvia winter, things on universalism. Extremely glad I took this course as in incoming grad student

I gained a deeper understanding of the literature and direction of scholarship in American religious history on US empire and religion, and also a crucial introductory foundation to scholarship and perspectives of transnational religion across and despite currents of imperial history and circumstances in the world. I especially appreciate the foundation in studies of Islam.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was excellent. My only recommendation for the course is to have it longer in the future so that there is more room for discussion!

The syllabus was inventively put together across a number of fields and disciplines, from American religious history to ethnic studies to anthropology to security studies. Because there are many ways a syllabus on religion and US empire could be put together, this certainly is not the only or ultimate iteration of such a course. Knowing this, I really loved how the instructors' expertise came together as vivid conversation partners and pedagogical collaborators in weaving through these fields and disciplines, making sure that, as a class, we were constantly questioning and rethinking what an "empire" was, and what "religion" was.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Without a doubt! This course is intellectually stimulating and the readings are phenomenal. The course being co-taught by two incredible academics (Tisa and Zareena) is such a gift as both bring unique perspectives.
I would only recommend if you do have a interest in all forms of religious studies. I found my interest disappearing as I learned things outside my sphere of interest .
Yes! The material you will learn, the conversations you will have, and the questions you will gain are exciting, critical, and invaluable.
